1b5e4f5c-922e-40c4-aee5-78650d9e1444.description: The earner has detailed knowledge of the key issues in facilities management and the technical skills that are key to the role of operations and facilities supervisors, including safety and energy efficiency improvements.
1b5e4f5c-922e-40c4-aee5-78650d9e1444.name: Operations and Facilities Management Part 1

badge_template_activities.title: The earner understands all the factors involved in running a building. They have knowledge in the key roles, responsibilities and stakeholders of facilities management  Have demonstrated knowledge in proactive risk minimisation and management.  Understand real world compliance, certification and audit processes. Thorough knowledge of property operations efficiency and contractor management and can budget and report on sustainability.

d54cdbb7-521d-4a5b-be7f-91f748214630.description: The earner demonstrates knowledge of property as an asset class in the context of the capital markets. d54cdbb7-521d-4a5b-be7f-91f748214630.name: Property Investment & Finance Part 1

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has applied knowledge of the drivers of property performance, roles of risk and return, public and private funding, and valuation principles to practical scenarios during the course.

b5f53435-dde9-4fae-a918-3802a7223d26.description: The earner has completed the suite of Operations & Facilities Management courses and assessments which have been designed and delivered by industry leaders and are highly honoured within the Property Industry.
b5f53435-dde9-4fae-a918-3802a7223d26.name: Operations and Facilities Management Industry Diploma

badge_template_activities.title: The earner demonstrates a working knowledge of writing a business case to gain approval for completion of a building facilities upgrade; and can develop strategic solutions for a major refurbishment and demonstrates knowledge of the use of FM tools.
Operations and Facilities Management Part 1
Operations and Facilities Management Part 2

The earner has completed a post-course assessment which demonstrates a working knowledge of:  (a) writing a business case to gain approval for completion of a building facilities upgrade; and (b) strategic solutions to a major refurbishment or the use of FM tools in a practical scenario.

209efef6-a570-4b9f-82c1-ab65363ffe72.description: The earner demonstrates an understanding of their state's land use planning systems, and their implications for urban development.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has sound knowledge in the importance of planning, structure and interaction of various federal, state and local government planning documents, Planning permit applications, processes and timeframes, Planning scheme amendment processes and timeframes, Development assessment applications, processes and timeframes, Community involvement in planning, Impact of planning on project feasibility

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has developed skills in Complaints and Dispute Resolution, Customer Service, running effective committee meetings, Integrated Care Model and Ageing Well in Australia, Dementia, Mental Health and Elder Abuse in Retirement Villages and Effective Management of Village Finances.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner now understands how to prioritise leasing and understands how it can enhance value. The earner understands the core market needs and drivers of commercial, retail and industrial property.

alignments.description: The Property Council is committed to promoting integrity and maintaining the highest standard of ethical conduct in all our activities.
